comment: Very easy class if you keep up with the assignments. Not a super heavy workload, but the online labs gave me a bit of trouble but that's because of me I think lol.

Dr. Suther is a great science teacher. I took his Climatology class despite being a POLS major and I did just fine. I was lazy and did not read and study as much as I should have because I'm not a science person and I still did okay. He did group projects which brought my grade up really high and saved my butt. He's amazing at explaining things!

Suther is a nice guy and a good professor as well. His lectures are straight forward and matches with the exams pretty well. He does not throw curveballs and tells you how it is. Exams are not too difficult but do require some effort when studying.

very clear about everything from the beginning, deadlines extremely strict, no extensions or late submissions, 3 tests, 9 labs but one is dropped, and 3 discussions, can find most of the answers online, will answer emails and questions about labs quickly, very easy A as long as you don't forget to do stuff
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: He HAS to know what you look like and is very strange.

This class is overall pretty average. The tests are super easy but the labs can be difficult. It's not the information that is hard it is the system that you have to do the lab with which can be completely off or make no sense. There are also a few discussions that are super easy. He is a great professor I just wish the lab setups were different.
I hate this class so much it made me want to pollute the earth.

There are 9 labs and 3 tests. The labs are pretty hard, but he drops your lowest lab grade. The tests are extremely easy. He rounds up your grade at the end of the semester if you're within .5 of a grade. This class is just hard in general, but if you do the work, you'll get a good grade.

Professor Suther is a good online professor. Responds to emails in a reasonable time and is very helpful if you are confused with a lab. Grade comprised of several labs and three exams (no lockdown). Only thing is the labs are difficult at times because the tools don't always work very well and some of it just seems like guesswork at a few points.

Took it online. Few Tests but all answers can be found. No lockdown. Labs weekly and pretty annoying but with some common sense and motivation you could get As and Bs on them and with the high test grades you should get you will be fine.

This class is absolutely terrible, I highly recommend avoiding it however possible. The content is not necessarily hard, but the labs formatting is horrendous. I did well overall, but I spent much too long on each assignment for a 1000 class. The class averages of the labs were constantly 70s and even 60s. Avoid avoid avoid.

Professor Suther is honestly a good professor. If I had to pick something to criticize about him, I would say that he does not chose the best platform for labs for this class. The platform is very buggy and he does not give much leniency or grace for that. I would take him again, simply because the work is quite easy and quite hard to fail.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Not the easiest A but is decent in workload. Would definitely recommend it to people who learn well on their own. There are 9 labs (lowest grade dropped) and 3 exams. The textbook will help a bunch. I don't know much about the professor himself, but if I ask him a question about a lab question, the answers are usually vague and unhelpful.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Do not take this class, the labs are on a program that is very unreliable and you wont get above a C, nobody in my class did. Tests are on quizlet however.

GEOG 1113 is not a hard course but you definitely have to try to pass. There was a lab due every week and it was not difficult but it was very time consuming and you had to have to study the material to understand the lab. Tests were very straight forward & not hard either. As long as you study and do all the labs, you'll be fine. 10/10 recommend

Dr. Suther is communicative, supportive, and responds promptly to emails. Though he's very nice, the exams seem overly difficult for a 1000-level course. Labs are fine, though poor-quality; some are easy, others are hard and need clarification. 9 labs (the lowest score is dropped) and 3 exams. Overall, good professor but a rigorous course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The material for the class was kind of hard. if you take your time with the labs, they aren't that hard, but they can get confusing. The labs were harder than the tests. I had to email Professor Suther about the labs a couple times and he responded back quickly. There's also extra credit, which can boost your grade by a couple points.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Suther is a great professor; the curriculum for the course is COMPLETE garbage. The labs are outdated and loaded with broken links. The instructions he gives are sometimes hard to follow (sometimes so hard to follow he just gives you the answers). He is readily accessible when you need him, and is willing to work with you if you are upfront.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Online class so I can't say much about his personality. The curriculum mandated by the school is god awful. This class was harder than my 4 three-thousand level upper division requirement classes I took at the same time because of it. Interesting material, and Suther seems cool enough, but the material sucked.

Because this was an online class, I didn't really get to know Dr. Suther very well. That's similar to most online courses, but the little communication I did have with Dr. Suther personally was a good experience. He emails back within minutes, which is really refreshing for an online course. I'd take him again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very nice professor, replies promptly and gives help when requested.  Do both extra credit opportunities in the beginning of the semester!  Google labs are horrible!  Takes a lot of time!!!  Tests  are hard but if you use the provided study guide that will help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really enjoyed this course. There is a lot of material covered, but he gives you a fair chance if you are willing to put in the work.

I had him for Landforms online and felt like I learned a lot. You have to do the labs on Google Earth which take some time, but they are pretty easy. I've never made anything less than an A on them. If you read the book and study you'll be fine. Just be responsible and don't procrastinate otherwise it's stressful.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Weekly modules are Google Earth which take 2hrs min to complete. Study guide pertain to roughly 20-30% of test (each test covers extensive amount of material over 3 modules). If you miss an assignment or test, tough. Will not let you make up under ANY circumstance. Happened to me, ended up with a C even after 88 and 2As on tests. Awful experience.

The Hardest Teacher I've taken at KSU. The homework assignments are impossible, 3 test which again are impossible, like you need a PH.D to take this class, and very little extra credit. Do not take Climatology!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! At first I was interested in weather but after taking this class nope. The textbook was terrible.
Nice teacher but worst class I've taken at KSU. Very hard class.  Do not Take.

The material in this class can get pretty dry, but Dr. Suther tries to make it at least bearable. If you pay attention to what he says in class and at least try on the labs, this class is a piece of cake.

Excellent professor, have had for a few years. Always reliable through email. Will respond to any question in class, and will research in order to get back to you if necessary.   ALWAYS knows and understands his topic of lecture in detail, and is an excellent speaker.   I intentionally seek out his classes for as many as possible.

Too much content for a gen ed course. Pratically have to rewrite power points to study for each of his 4 exams that count for over half your grade. I stressed about this class more than my 3000 level courses this semester. I would not recommend if you already have a heavy workload. His class is do-able just stressful.

is not a good teacher for an introductory course.  I have upper level courses that I do not have to study for as much. He puts massive amounts of content on his test. He gives you a study guide but says it does not cover everything you need to know. I feel like he teaches an intro course like an upper division class.

Prof is very nice, easy going. Gets right to the point and stays on topic. Lectures directly from PPs which you can print and follow along. You do need to study well for tests which cover a lot of material. Take advantage of lab time to ask questions,and he is very helpful. Attendance counts 10% which can mean the difference in a letter grade.

Dr. Suther is a new professor. He covers a great deal of material. He is very helpful and available if needed. The exams are hard, you MUST study. He does give a review prior to the exams. There are some fairly easy homework assignments and a final group project. Overall I would recommend this professor,do plan to put effort into the class.
